sn2.3:4.2: Then, late at night, the beautiful god Māgha, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
sn2.3:4.4: and addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.3:5.1: “When what is incinerated do you sleep at ease?
sn2.3:5.2: When what is incinerated is there no sorrow?
sn2.3:6.1: “When anger’s incinerated you sleep at ease.
sn2.3:6.2: When anger’s incinerated there is no sorrow.
sn2.3:6.3: Vatrabhū, anger has a poisoned root,
sn2.3:6.5: The noble ones praise its killing,
sn2.3:6.6: for when it’s incinerated there is no sorrow.”
